intro: Triotosiphon venezuelana, commonly known as the Venezuelan triotosiphon, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Venezuela. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along streambanks. Its botanical features include a slender stem, aromatic foliage, and small white to greenish flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer.
